column2: Bru316, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have had kidney stones for about 12 years, not really sure how well it works,but I see the casing in my stool, I wonder if it is really working.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I first took this medicine 40 years ago and thought it had disappeared from the chemist. Then I rediscovered it a couple of years ago and it is a life saver in emergencys.

column2: Newmoon, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Previously I was passing kidney stones weekly with increasing difficulty & ER visits. I've taken PC for 5 months now and stones completely subsided since the second month.  I do experience some stomach upset and loose bowel symptoms which respond reasonably well to adjustments in diet. However, I've also experienced a sudden unexplained weight gain during this same time period which I suspect may be related to the PC. It's been highly effective for me in preventing the recurrence of kidney stones.

column2: Diane, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Been on this Pot. citrate for over 20 years and really I have had more stones then ever before. Anything to make drug companies more money.

column2: karalot, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: You absolutely must follow directions regarding taking this drug with food and water. I have been on and off this drug for recurrent kidney stones and hematuria. I have fewer stones when taking it.

column2: 6knrzx, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have now been told the pill form is not available is this true? What else in pill form is comparable

column2: molly, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this medication for one week. I started with 3 10mequps per day, decreased to one per day but I can't take anymore. The side effects still horrible. Nausea, abdominal pain, headache,squezing feeling on my chest, my neck and right arm pain is increasing.

column2: PeterPeterPE, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I could NOT swallow these huge pills,so I broke them into pieces, even tho the pharmacist said it wasn't a good idea. Why don't they make smaller pills!  I wasn't warned of possible weakness and irregular heartbeat. After two weeks my cardiologist discovered, via lab tests, that I had a very high potassium level...the kidneys were not getting rid of it, and I had to go to the ER and take an antidote.  For 2 weeks I had felt so weak.  Two days after taking the antidote, and stopping the pills, I felt MUCH better, and my pulse settled down to normal.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: The effect from taking these pills after 10 days 4 pill per day is intestinal pain and frequent and urgent, loose bowel movements.  Mild headache and some dizziness.  Urine tested daily has not changed.

column2: sclark45373, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was prescibed this med 20mg 2x daily. After the first 2 days i noticed that everytime I would take the medicine I would get a migraine shortly afterwards. I called my doctor and he lowered my dosage to once a day but I'm still getting the migraines, only now i am not at work with it.

column2: martee, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking (3) 10mEq a day, 10 days after taking I noticed numbness and tingling in my toes and fingers along with rapid heart beat. Went to ER and tests were normal and ER Dr. said it was probably my caffeine intake!! Sorry do not drink coffee, haven't drinken soda since June 2007 when I 1st passed a kidney stone. Had my Dr. lower my dosage to (2) a day, seemed to be going well for 4 months now and I just noticed swelling in my fingers, only because my rings were so tight my ring finger was actually red and not getting circulation! Had more blood tests, showing everything is fine, which isn't ok with me, took myself off the Pot. Citrate and noticed after 1 week my rings can fit again. Not at all happy with taking this med, and will now see what other alternatives I have from my kidney stone doctor.
